page.title: 02HONING E.RUSTON LAND USE
page.content: Our area covers the civil parish of Honing and the western half, more or less, of E.Ruston. Much of the land is the good free draining loam typical of East Norfolk but there is more variation than is usual in the better parts of the region and the less favored patches are numerous and some are fairly extensive. Woodlands, parks and commons and uncultivated wet lands are estimated at 15% or more. The most extensively grown crop is wheat, followed by barley and sugar beet and by vegetable crops mainly on contract for processing, these comprising potatoes, peas and beans. Fruit, formerly a local speciality, has very recently disappeared. Grassland, whether temporary or permanent, is of minor importance, as are the various livestock enterprises, principally beef cattle and pigs.
